p: Over several decades, methods to interrogate antigen-specific MBCs have had several useful functions: identifying subset of MBCs available to respond to repeat infections ( 27, 28), tracking MBCs prior to and after vaccination or booster ( 6), isolating and characterizing human mAbs following natural infection or vaccination ( 29), and analyzing memory-derived antibody repertoires ( 28). Only recently have these methods been employed in the DENV field. Here we review the leading approaches for characterizing human DENV MBCs, evaluating their strengths, limitations and potential for further contribution to the field (summarized in Table 1).
